title: Police find car used in St. Pete drive-by shooting that hit 3-year-old
content:
Police officers recovered the car believed to be involved in a drive-by shooting that injured two people — including a 3-year-old girl — near Lake Maggiore, about two miles away from the crime scene in south St. Petersburg.
The car, a white 2011 Dodge Challenger, was discovered parked and abandoned at Dell Holmes Park, 2741 20th St. S. about 11 p.m. Thursday, the St. Petersburg Police Department said.
The car was impounded and towed. It will be processed by forensic technicians, police said.
Police continue to investigate the shooting.
St. Petersburg police said the driver of the four-door car opened fire at people on the porch of a residence in the 1200 block of 10th Avenue South on Thursday afternoon.
Terrell Holliman, 23, was shot, along with 3-year-old Jayla Mack, who was struck in the abdomen. Both were expected to survive.
Stay with TBO.com for updates.
